content.description:
Begin from the left end of the bushy ledge at the base and climb up and left to gain a short hanging right-facing flake crack (finger sized cams). From its top, make cruxy moves up and right over overlaps (look for a cam placement under one of these) and finish up to the belay tree. Serious and bouldery climbing.

On the left side of the slabby dome down and left from the start of Wayback Layback - the climb starts in front of the fallen tree that is walked to reach the belay block for Wayback etc. Rappel from the belay tree that is shared with Bootsauce.
A few finger sized cams and nuts.

Climb large featured holds on the right side of the small dome down and left of Bootsauce, moving left near the top. Named for the style of the first ascent - originally climbed in cowboy boots.

This is the right hand route on the small dome located down and left of the start of Wayback Layback. Climb to a belay tree (shared with Bloody Finger) and rappel off.
Inventive pro - a few small to medium cams and wires. Not a straightforward crack climb but enough gear is present with searching to keep you off the deck.

Climb the long, sustained, right leaning finger crack. A mix of jamming and face climbing with a few tiny face holds for rests. Near the top it is possible to stem right to the next crack (Sliver) At top, move left under block to the belay of Wayback Layback. 
  
 A massive sandbag at 10d in the original Bluffs guide.

Just right of Wayback Layback, the central crack line up this section of cliff.
Lots of finger size gear - small to med. nuts and #0 TCU to #4 metolius sized pieces.

The right hand crack on the Wayback Layback wall, start up Crack of Dawn and move right immediately into the far right crack; follow it to the top, generally not using Crack of Dawn. The fourth crack, a partial seam that only extends partway down the cliff, becomes useful near the top. 
  
 Possibly never redpointed; the grade is an extrapolation from the original Bluffs guide grade of 11+.

The right-hand of three prominent right leaning diagonal cracks on the Wayback Layback wall.
Very thin to 1"

Climb easy ramp past two small saplings to overlap. Strenous first crux come in the overlap, balance left into akward layback in the thin crack. Second crux comes in thin section jsut before crack widens. Battle the pump and layback into the final crux in the mess of thin cracks and pockets. Finish at tree. Not to be underestimated, very pumpy.

Right of Sleeping Princess, right where trail meets the cliff. Look for steep face with splitter cracks, Wayback Layback is the lefthand crack.
small cams, doubles in the finger sizes.
Climbs in the vicinity of Wayback Layback
